Checklists for Assessments, QA Indicators and Equipment

The checklist format is shared by three types of items:

l Nursing assessments for evaluating aspects of a patient’s condition in critical care and post-anesthesia environment. Assessments are designed to appear on flowsheets.

Note: No standard flowsheet exists for this type of data; if users will document assessments, you must create a custom flowsheet and configure it to include assessments.

l QA Indicators collect data related to quality assurance requirements for surgery patients. These items are designed for a specialized window of the same name.

Note: To include an item in the QA Indicators window, it must be part of a default protocol configured for the template. Depending on the workstation configuration, QA Indicators may or may not appear on flowsheets.

l Equipment lists collect data about equipment and supplies used during the procedure. These items are designed for a specialized window of the same name.

Note: To include an item in the Equipment window, it must be part of a default protocol configured for the template. Depending on the workstation configuration, equipment lists may or may not appear on flowsheets.

After creating an checklist, you will need to define its content by adding items to the Assessment Items table. Assessment and equipment items cannot be deleted from the database.

 

 

How to...

l Create an assessment

l Create a new QA indicator

l Create a new equipment list

l Edit a checklist (assessments, QA indicators, equipment)
